title: Cyber Daily: Twitch Hack Exposes 6-Figure Payouts
text:
Scroll down for more news, plus good stuff to read over the weekend.

United Kingdom Under Attack

The data paints a clear picture: record-breaking numbers of DDoS attacks continue to threaten weak spots in the UK. Explore the UK's country profile from our threat intelligence report to see how.

Read more

Data Leak

The Twitch data leak shows some big pay days for streamers but some say the leaked information isn't the full picture. The video streaming platform said it suffered a data breach, with information leaked on the online chat forum 4chan. The company declined to comment on what information was accessed.

Tanya DePass, a 48-year-old Twitch streamer in Chicago who is sponsored by videogame-accessories maker Logitech G, said her Twitch earnings vary greatly from month to month. Ms. DePass streams herself playing either videogames and tabletop games for 10 to 25 hours a week under the name Cypheroftyr. She said she was frustrated by the leak because she thinks it gives people the false impression that streaming is an easy way to make lots of money.

The 4chan user who allegedly posted the Twitch data labeled it "part one," suggesting there might be more to come.

Read the full story.

Read more: Twitch leaker claims to have source code and internal security tools

More Cyber and Privacy News

When cyber incidents ding revenue: U.K.-based Weir Group PLC disclosed Thursday what it described as "an attempted ransomware attack" in September that led the engineering company to shut down some tech systems and delay shipments of certain industrial products. Disruptions to engineering, manufacturing and shipping are ongoing as Weir works to fully restore core enterprise software, it said. The company expects to see revenue reduced in the fourth quarter and into 2022. (Reuters)

San Diego-based Scripps Health said recently that a May ransomware attack resulted in a revenue drop of $91.6 million. The hospital system shut down tech systems and suspended a range of medical services while it dealt with the incident.

SmileDirectClub Inc. said in August that revenue slipped when an April cyberattack led to shipping delays.

PHS

Counter-intelligence information stolen: report. The individuals who compromised SolarWinds and Microsoft software and hacked into nine U.S. government agencies stole sensitive information related to Russia, Reuters reports, citing people familiar with the hacking investigations. U.S. officials have blamed the hacks on Russia, which has denied involvement.

The hackers took information on U.S. policy for sanctioning Russians as well as details about counter-intelligence investigations, the people said.

Talent. Preparedness. Governance. We want to know what you think. Take our survey.

WSJ Pro Cybersecurity is conducting a short survey on some of the more vexing cyber issues. Results will be shared in December. Thank you for your participation!
